column1: == Monuments and parks ==
Groenendaal park: Designed by John Hope
column2: it was formed by merging several country estates into one.

column1: Vrijheidsbeeld (Freedom Statue)
column2: statue by Mari Andriessen to celebrate freedom and commemorate Heemstede victims of the Dutch Revolt. Located on the Vrijheidsdreef in Groenendaal park.

column1: Slot Heemstede: The site of the Heemstede castle.
Hartekamp: Heemstede summer home of George Clifford
column2: who hired Linnaeus to write his 'Hortus Cliffortianus'
column3: a detailed catalogue of the plant specimens in the herbarium and gardens of Hartecamp. George Clifford's house is closed to the public
column4: but the surrounding gardens are used as a campus and are open to visitors.

column1: Linnaeusbos (Linnaeus Forest): Originally a part of Hartekamp that was planted by George Clifford and documented by Linnaeus. In 2007
column2: Heemstede celebrated Linnaeus's 300th birthday.

column1: De Naald: The 'needle' is a monument placed by D.J. van Lennep to honor Witte van Haemstede
column2: the savior of Haarlem at a battle which on April 26
column3: 1304 and to honor the wounded of another battle fought against the Spanish on July 8
column4: 1573. Both battles supposedly took place right at the corner of David Jacob van Lennep's house Huis te Manpad

column1: == Transport ==
The town is served by Heemstede-Aerdenhout railway station
column2: which lies on the Oude Lijn between Haarlem and Leiden.
